result.execSummary:
The defendant Torrance D Ruffin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge; to be paid through collection by the DOC  from 25% of funds and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. The Court does not assess other Court costs due to inability to pay.

To be served in the Wisconsin State Prison system
Consecutive to: to any other sentence, Straight Time.  Good Time to apply.
Court advises the defendant he cannot posses firearms or body armor and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Torrance D Ruffin

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: original CR-154 did not reflect DOC collect

Defendant Torrance D Ruffin in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Defendant Torrance D Ruffin in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk 
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to serve  6 MONTHS straight time at the House of Corrections to be served in the Wisconsin State Prison system with 109 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence.  Good time to apply.   Defendant is ordered to provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharges.  Court does not assess any other court costs due to inability to pay.    The Court ordered that DNA surcharges  be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.  Appeal rights given.
Filed with the Court:  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief & Pretrial Incarceration Credit form
Sentencing hearing scheduled for 10-16-2015 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Torrance D Ruffin in court with Attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Defendant Torrance D Ruffin in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint and enters a judgment of conviction.

COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms or body armor, he must provide a DNA sample and pay the surcharge and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  

Court orders case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 19.
Clerk:  jms

Attorney Victoria Mccandless in court, defendant Torrance D Ruffin not in court, in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests plea and sentencing date. All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Dennis Cimpl, Branch 19, in Room 313 of the Safety Building due to rotation.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 3, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Torrance D Ruffin in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Defendant Torrance D Ruffin in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Return on bench warrant held. Bail hearing proceeded. Arguments by counsel.  Defense requests scheduling date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant missed court on 05/08/2015.  Defendant is currently in custody on warrant.  Case is adjourned for a Return on Warrant on 05/21/2015 at 8:30am, in Branch 22.  Parties notified.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($2,500.00 signature bond) ad
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 2500.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Victoria Mccandless in court.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant failing to appear for scheduling conference, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.

Defendant Torrance D Ruffin in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Certification of transcript of proceedings of PRELIMINARY HEARING commencing 03/09/2015. received and filed. (10 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to Victoria Mccandless, 819 N. 6th, Milwaukee, WI 53233.

Defendant Torrance D Ruffin in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Michael Kessler, student intern under the supervision of Irene Parthum for Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Lora VanderSchaaf-Village of Shorewood Police Department Detective.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for 03-09-2015 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Torrance D Ruffin
Current: 6940 West Medford Avenue, Milwaukee, WI 53218   (Effective: 02-25-2015)
Prior: 6940 West Medford Avenue, Milwaukee, WI 53218

Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court ordered defendant to report for booking and release no later than 3:00 p.m. on 02-26-2015.

Defendant Torrance D Ruffin in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
OCCR Tape #15-038

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
Court orders case adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.
Clerk:  jms
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 2/25/15 @ 1:30pm
